text.section: In addition to any other penalty provided by this title, the Department or the court may suspend for a period not exceeding 5 years the hunting license or hunting privileges of a person who is convicted of a State or federal hunting violation.

The Department shall adopt regulations:
To implement this section; and
That list the criteria for the suspension of a hunting license or the hunting privileges of a person.

section.section:
During a period of suspension of a hunting license or the hunting privileges of a person imposed by the Department or the court, the person may not:
Hunt, trap, or pursue game in the State; or
Purchase or attempt to purchase another hunting license.
A suspension imposed in accordance with this section is in addition to any other penalty authorized under this title.

The Department shall initiate any proceeding to suspend a hunting license or hunting privileges under paragraph (2)(ii) of this subsection immediately after the time for filing an appeal of the second conviction has passed.

Before the suspension of a hunting license or hunting privileges under this section, the Department shall notify the licensee or person in writing of the licensee's or person's right to a hearing on request.

If a licensee or person submits a written request for a hearing to the Department within 30 days after the date that the notice required under this paragraph is mailed, the Department shall:
Hold a hearing after providing at least 10 days' notice to the licensee or person; and
Conduct the hearing in accordance with Title 10, Subtitle 2 of the State Government Article.

The Department may suspend a hunting license or hunting privileges without a hearing if:
The licensee or person does not submit a written request for a hearing; or
The licensee or person fails to appear for a scheduled hearing for which the Department provided notice.
